value.title: DAX Fridays! #126: Understand the Formula Engine and Storage Engine to optimize your DAX queries
value.excerpt: To be able to optimize DAX queries, you need to know how the formula engine and the storage engine work with them, so how about we let them explain themselves? #curbal #powerbi #dax #DAXFridays  Hope you enjoy the video, i had fun doing it :)  Have you missed the Vertipaq series? value.title: DAX Fridays! #183: How to deal with multiple dates in Power BI
value.excerpt: So you have order date, shipped date, required date....and only one calendar. How do you manage that in power bi and DAX?  This scenario is often called role playing dimensions and in this video I will show you two ways to solve it. :) Happy Friday!!  Links to videos mentioned: Introduction to data modeling:

value.title: DAX Fridays! #21: USERELATIONSHIP
value.excerpt: A common example in a Power BI table is to have multiple dates, which are related to the same Date table. As you are limited to one active relationship, we need to use the DAX function USERELATIONSHIP to manage the inactive relationships.  Link to Power BI file: https://curbal.com/blog/glossary/userelationship-dax

value.title: DAX Fridays #214: Create DAX calculations on ranges taken from a slicer!!
value.excerpt: In today's video, I will show you how you can grab the values selected on a slicer and use them as a range to make calculations, for example: 1. Sales variance between multiple years 2. Rank across multiple years and many more!  Here you can download all the pbix files: https://curbal.com/donwload-center

value.title: DAX Fridays! #30: SEARCH vs FIND
value.excerpt: In today's DAX Fridays! tutorial we are going to go though examples on how to use two DAX functions: SEARCH and FIND  SEARCH and FIND DAX functions are used to find the number of characters at which a specific word is found in a column.
